dialogues.text: Yeah, of course. Because of the booths.

dialogues.text: Yes. And because of the bitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can all be ours. 30 percent for you, 70 percent for me. You just gotta help me out here. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay looks conflicted. Dwayne goes dark, like a spurned lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starting to wonder if my dream book was wrong about you. Maybe you sitting behind me doesn't mean you're my road dog. Maybe it means you're plotting to stab me in the back, like some snake in the grass.

dialogues.text: That's crazy. I'd never do something like that. The dream book was right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. I'll do it. But I'm not shooting him or anything. I'll hold him while you shoot him. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a fact: they don't build prisons for criminals, they build them for idiots. Shit, they got three different types of CSI on TV, just laying out how the police do their business...and still, idiots like you think you can just go out and do a murder yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you wanna be a millionaire, you gotta think like one. And millionaires don't kill people. They hire assassins. Which I did. We gotta pay him on Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why would you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was presented with an opportunity. I took it. 100 thousand bucks for a highly trained assassin is a steal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we don't have that kinda money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're addressing the real problem: how do we get the 100 grand? 'Cause once we get that, we get the million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And once we get the million, we will literally own this town and every single thing in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we could just...rob a bank. One of these local banks with nothing but a dipshit security guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, not quite thinking like a millionaire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then let's hire someone to rob a bank.

dialogues.text: Dwayne thinks about this for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck hiring them, we could just force someone to rob a bank for us. Like with blackmail, or death threats, or -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bomb. Everyone's scared of a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna say hypnotism...but I like that. It's out of the fucking box. We just strap one to some motherfucker's chest, like we did to those watermelons. Think you can you build some kinda bomb vest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean...camel jockeys do it in caves. I got a garage workshop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure this is exactly how a millionaire would do it. And the beauty of it is: we don't lose any sleep, 'cause no one gets hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except The Major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The Major dies. But no one gets hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne smiles. But a nagging thought interrupts him - 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's just one problem. Where do we get our guy? 'Cause if we do a kidnapping, then we're right back where we started...doing shit that's gonna get us caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we need is someone to come to us...to a place where we can control the situation. Someone without any connection to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys stare at each other, stumped. Until something catches Dwayne's attention...a local commercial playing o the flat-screen. A PIZZA CHEF slides a pizza into a box -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys look at each other.

dialogues.text: Sometimes fate just takes out its cock and slaps you in the face with it.

dialogues.text: A hand grabs a beer from the fridge.

dialogues.text: Will heads into the living room with the beer. The voice belongs to Danny Glover. The guys are watching Lethal Wea Murtaugh (Danny Glover) has just stopped Riggs (Mel Gibso from killing himself. Riggs looks at him, crazily, before

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Fridge is full, man. We're all good. 21.

dialogues.text: Let me ask you a question. You remember Tom Small?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he used to kick our asses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Kate told me about it last night. I thought you should know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two were swapping stories about getting fingered? That's pretty cute.

dialogues.text: Chet chuckles. Will ignores him, sips his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sneaky son of a bitch...you want to fuck my sister, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, if you guys had that twin ESP shit this would be a completely different situation. There'd be logistical problems.

dialogues.text: We look exactly alike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so fucked up I can't even begin to process it. How long has this been going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Well, you know who I saw naked? Jenny Rifkin. While I was nailing her. The week after she dumped you.

dialogues.text: Why do you think every time you wanna bet on whose cock's bigger I'm always willing to go in? 'Cause I know mine's bigger. 'Cause she told me!

dialogues.text: Wow...wow. You pulled a Judas on Jenny fucking Rifkin. That is messed up. Almost as messed up as how I sold your Cal Ripken signed ball for 200 bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna apologize, don't you? You look like shit. You've probably been up for days thinking about what an asshole you were. Well, it's gonna take a lot more than some pathetic groveling -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet! Shut up! I don't wanna apologize to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do you want? Because we don't have anything left to say to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here goes. And this is gonna sound crazy. Because it is fucking crazy. But last night two guys in masks jumped me and strapped a bomb to my chest, and now I have less than eight hours to rob a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet just stares at Will, unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hysterical. Got me. Great joke. I'm going back to work now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will steps in Chet's way. He unbuttons his jacket, reveal the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck? Is that real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will nods. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet jumps backward, stumbles over a desk and scurries on his ass to the other end of the classroom. He presses him flat against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from me! What the fuck are you involved in!? Terrorism!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet, do you really think I'm a terrorist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! One of the dumb ones! The ones they convince to wear the bombs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not fucking around here. Two guys did this to me. And if I don't rob that bank in time this thing is gonna blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your first idea was to come to a school filled with young children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just back the fuck away from me with that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will backs all the way up, so that the guys are on opposi ends of the classroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I think the vest is safe for now. These guys don't want me to blow myself up on accident before I get their money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so you figure the two psychopaths that rigged a bomb to your chest made sure it was safe? There's no margin for error in their fucking bomb vest design!? 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! All I do know is that this is real. This is happening. And I'm sure you hate me as much as I hate you right now, but I have nowhere else to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For help, Chet. I need your help. Please. I can't do this alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet looks Will over. His desperation is palpable. Chet bites his lip, weighing the situation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! (takes a breath) I'd like to tell you to get fucked, but you know what the problem is...I'm a better man than you. And someday, I might actually forgive you. So if I let you blow up, or whatever, that shit might come back and eat at my conscience, and totally affect my relationships with other people. Like my wife and kids and shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a...very rational way to look at the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're right, about being a better guy than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet takes a step toward Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure that thing isn't gonna blow at any second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will just looks at Chet...unable to offer any assurance. After a beat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you just walk a few feet in front of me for a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will opens the door, stops, looks back at Chet. 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will heads out. Chet takes a breath, bracing himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will walks down the empty hallway. He glances back over h shoulder, where Chet walks several feet behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm still here. I really am this stupid. Just pay attention to where you're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These floors get waxed once a week. On Tuesday, which today is. You hit a slick patch, trip and fall, and I got a classroom full of kids wearing their skin inside out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet, I'm fucking nervous enough as it is. Please. I don't need you back seat driving me right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stops, turns back toward Chet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for the record, this isn't a nuclear weapon strapped to my chest. And there are metal lockers on either side of the hallway. If I fall, and if this thing goes off, I'm probably not taking out the whole school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really want to debate this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sighs, turns back around. A second later, the school bell rings and kids flood the hallway, changing classes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will freezes. Multiple kids shove past him. Chet sweats bullets, gives Will a look of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat, the hallway empties again. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will continues walking. He tries to lighten the mood -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was the chick in the white jeans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristi Evans. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. Just keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys' voices fade as they continue down the hallway..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on yourself. You knew exactly who I was talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. She's in the eighth grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you love it when she calls you Mr. Chet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't call me "Mr. Chet." She's not a foreigner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys get to Will's car. Chet wraps up a call on his c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...thanks so much, Mrs. Davis. I'll call you after I talk to the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet hangs up. He is standing by the passenger door. He looks over the roof of the car at Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what? 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once I step inside this car, I'm basically in a steel coffin with you and...that thing. And if it goes off, all they're gonna find in there are two charred bodies and pieces of a bomb. They'll assume we were driving to a government building to blow it up. It'll be all over the news. Next thing you now, some militia or Islam group is claiming us as members. My family will be humiliated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll also be dead, in that particular situation, so it won't really matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it. Take your time, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will gets in the car and shuts the door. He looks out at Chet, who stands uncertainly by the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the world's biggest favor, you motherfucker. You didn't even help me move last winter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet reluctantly hops in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will fires up the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Given the situation, I think you should obey all traffic safety laws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pulls out of the school parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea. I just got in your car. I thought you had a plan. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't! I've been sorta preoccupied with this crushing fear of death!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No plan. I can't say I'm surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your plan is probably better. Just condescend me until I explode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will goes to turn on the radio. Chet grabs his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should turn on the radio. See if the signal sets the bomb off. That would be an interesting experiment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will heaves a frustrated sigh. Chet eases up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, let's just go back to my place. Figure out our options. Maybe you can get the vest off or something. I just don't want to do anything stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless we have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car hits a rough pothole. Chet's heart skips a beat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy fucking shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and he throws himself against the passenger side window as far from Will as the confines of the car will allow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will slams the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! You're scaring the fuck out of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet makes the sign of the cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cool now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will continues driving. Chet discreetly unlocks the passe side door. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in case I have to jump out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I survive the day, and you don't because you jumped out of a moving car and broke your neck, I'm gonna laugh my ass off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if abandoning ship saves my life, then that laugh will be mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys continue driving in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER COUNTDOWN: 6 hours, 59 minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is shut. Will sits on the toilet lid. He has the jacket off and we get our first complete look at the vest The actual structure is composed of hollow metal tubes. T wiring that runs throughout the vest is messy and complic purposely so, to scare anyone out of fucking with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will is in the process of trying to contort his arm so he can slide the vest off...no luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too tight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is calling off toward the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Chet is crouched in a corner, at the furthest point the furthest room from the bathroom. He uses his laptop t look for websites on disarming a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we try to separate your shoulder? 42.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, all these sites say different shit. There's not a lot of consensus in the bomb disarming community.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will emerges from the bathroom, sliding the jacket back o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is pointless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet shuts his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree. We gotta call the cops, have them fly in the bomb squad or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't. These guys said they'd be following me. And I don't have a clue what they look like. For all I know, they're outside right now. They see the cops show up, they blow the vest and cut their losses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stares at Chet, hopelessly overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do, man? What do I do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Will...I guess you gotta rob the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been inside a bank in three years! How the fuck am I supposed to rob one!? They wouldn't even give me a savings account!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will drops onto the couch and puts his head in his hands, fighting hysterics. Chet offers a stock reassurance -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not! I'm gonna blow up! That's way worse than getting stabbed or shot. At least some people survive that. No one survives being blown up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one is ever like, "Yeah, I heard Steve got blown up, tough break, but how's he doing now? Is he still in the Rec basketball league?" No of course he isn't, 'cause there's nothing left of Steve except a stain on the wall and a pair of fucking high tops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet looks on as his friend begins to sob. It's a crushin sight. Chet strides across the apartment -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull yourself together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and attempts to give him one of those "get a grip" slap But Will flinches and Chet slaps him right on the ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Fuck! I think you popped my eardrum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Shit. I didn't mean to do that. But just listen to me now. You're not gonna die. You wanna know why? Because you know exactly how to rob a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point Break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. That movie is like a how-to guide for bank robberies. You just bust in. Masks. Guns. Move fast. Stick to the tellers and don't bother with the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...I guess it's pretty simple, right? And it's just a local bank. The Donner-Wells on Charles Road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I applied for a job there like a year ago. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to be a teller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so what? It's a good job. You get benefits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what, a name tag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of benefits do you get? Free toppings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really clever. No one ever said that shit to me before. Anyway, this is perfect. You know the whole layout of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly. They didn't hand me the security schematics with the application. But I sat in the waiting area for like 20 minutes. I know what the place looks like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many guards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One. I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a great start. You can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna do it with me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was actually gonna stick to giving tips, ideas...motivational speeches. More of a consultant or advisory role.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Chet. Please. I'm begging you here. I need you on this. If I do it alone, I'm dead. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna cry again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a moment of weakness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'll fucking cry again if that's what it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should make you blow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Whip that shit out. I'm actually kinda curious. I wanna see if Jenny Rifkin lied to you. She obviously lied to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these guys want is 100 grand. We can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna rob a bank for 100 grand? Just leave the rest of the money sitting there? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess they're very modest criminals. Who the fuck cares? Wait...you said "we" right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet heaves a sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm putting my life on the line for 100 grand...what does 100 grand even buy these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car pulls into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Juicy waits by the service entrance, smoking a cigarette. She spots the car and runs over. It parks and the door opens. A glassy-eyed African-American man (30s) steps out. His muscled body is covered in calligraphic pr ink. This is VAUGHN. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juicy throws her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you so much, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't got enough dicks to keep you warm in that place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's not like that. Those guys get Juicy, but you get Marisol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Marisol...what I want is to get my money, kill that old ass man, then get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that's how it's gonna go. We're just waiting on a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my impatient face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think I can keep you entertained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juicy gets in the open driver side door and makes a show crawling over into the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluorescent lights and pop music. Will and Chet roam the aisles with a full shopping basket. They turn into the "Sports & Fitness" section, where they find a variety pistols. They are incredibly realistic, though clear and with orange nozzles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we go with the handguns...or the Uzis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handguns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's such a Murtaugh choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A check out conveyor belt, as the guys' purchases drift p air pistols, spray paint, ski masks, leather gloves, seve 5-Hour Energy drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tough REGISTER WOMAN looks at the guys with abject di

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you don't want to grab some condoms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because this is usually what men buy before they rape someone, and I want to make sure you all use protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, we're just...buying some stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that cash or credit for your rape kit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks in his empty wallet, takes out a credit card. Chet grabs his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll pay cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van is parked. Dwayne sits behind the wheel. Metallic "Ride the Lightning" begins to play loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really fucked up this mix tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne ejects the tape, tosses it at Jay in the passenger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not speed freaks knocking off a 7-Eleven. We're masterminding a heist here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Dwayne. That song just means a lot to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne shakes his head. He turns and looks out the windsh they're parked in the Walmart lot, watching the store ent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish he would hurry his shit up. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worried about that other guy he's with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man. He picked him up at a school. So long as there ain't any cops, he can take the whole town with him. I just want my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne surveys the area. Something catches his attention: the bland strip mall across the street. There's a Blockbu Subway, and an empty space in between. Dwayne smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You want me to run over to Subway, get us a couple sandwiches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had any vision, Jay, you'd know exactly what I'm thinking about right now. And it's not a sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look how well trafficked that shopping mall is. It's the perfect place for the tanning salon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay checks it out, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're totally right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about it, and I want you to start off working the counter. Sounds like a demotion, I know, but it's an important position. Because we're gonna be using code words and shit. For example, if a customer walks in and says he wants a tan, that just means he wants a tan. But if he says he wants a "deluxe tan," that means a blow job and you gotta get one of the girls in there to suck him off. You with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far. But what if he wants a fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's gonna be codes for everything: missionary, anal, black chicks. I got it all written down back home in my files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna bother getting into it with you right now, because you're supposed to be on lookout and you're no good at multitasking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. 'Cause they're about to get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne spots the Mustang pulling away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the van into gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will navigates the streets. Chet is in the back seat, whe he has newspaper spread out and is spray painting the air pistols, and much of the car, black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful, you're getting paint everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you really worried about your upholstery right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, because if I survive this shit I'm quitting my job. That means I'll probably have to give up my place and I'll be sleeping in the back of my car, which you're covering in toxic paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet touches up one of the guns, goes to flip it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That side isn't dry yet. You're about to ruin it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says it's fast drying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fast isn't the same as instant. You gotta let it sit for like 20 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you know? You do a lot of graffiti? 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I spray painted my bike last year after I got my license suspended. I didn't let it dry properly and I fucked it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time to sit around and literally watch paint dry. Aren't we going straight to the bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was actually thinking we need to stop and steal a car first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet drops the spray paint, whirls on Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No way! We've got a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, my car. I'm not gonna use it as a getaway vehicle. They can trace the plates. Even if we do get away, we'll be arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't hotwire a fucking automobile, and neither can you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I was thinking we'd steal one from your parents' friends. The Fishers. Remember how they used to pay us to clean their garage? They leave the keys in there. And they have a Datsun. That's a fast car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not stealing the Fishers' Datsun. Let's steal a car from your parents' friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will seethes. He whips the car over to the side of the ro and gets in Chet's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What friends? My parents don't have any. My dad moved away after your big mouth ruined his marriage and humiliated him, and no one wanted to hang out with the mom who everyone knew fucked a lifeguard. 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never should have told me! I was 13 years old. I couldn't process that kind of information. I had to tell someone else. (shakes his head) Fuck. I really am sorry about it. Okay? Despite what I said before. I was just a kid, but I messed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet looks at Will, expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? You're not gonna apologize for selling my Cal Ripken ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I'm sorry...I'm sorry that my family was going through a rough patch and I was smoking a ton of weed and listening to the Wu Tang Clan all the time. And that I needed some extra dough to indulge my habit. Which, in hindsight, was probably just a cry for help. But you never even noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Now I feel even worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sits there, stewing for a moment. Then he softens -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have stolen the ball. I knew it was wrong and I regretted it like the next day. I actually tried to buy it back but the guy wanted twice as much. I had to smoke even more weed just to get past the whole shitty incident. I guess that's why they call it a downward spiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate that you tried to buy it back. So, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should probably get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns back around, goes to pull out without looking 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horn blares as a speeding delivery truck barrels right them. Will slams the brakes, barely avoiding a collision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! Fuck! I just want this goddamn day to be over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Chet continues to freak -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER COUNTDOWN: 5 hours, 15 minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will keeps watch of the house. Chet squeezes through a ga window he has pried open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet drops ungracefully to the floor, right beside a well maintained 1977 Datsun 240Z.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet hurries over and unlocks the side door. Will enters, hauling the Walmart bag of supplies. He goes right for a set of hooks on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The keys aren't here. They always used to leave the keys out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. When we were teenagers. This is fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys ransack the garage. Chet knocks over a shelf ful of clutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will goes to the car and tries the handle. It's open. He scours the interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet peeks through the glass pane in the door. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fisher is coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he looks for an escape -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, oh shit. Are the keys in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will hops out of the car. He rifles through the Walmart b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pulls the ski masks out of the bag, along with one o the freshly painted air pistols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing what I have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will puts a ski mask on, then throws one to Chet. The doo opens and MR. FISHER (60s) enters. Chet quickly pulls dow his mask. It's backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will levels the pistol -

dialogues.speaker: MR. FISHER
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fisher braces himself against a wall. Chet fumbles to turn his mask around. Will affects a deep voice -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the car keys?

dialogues.speaker: MR. FISHER
dialogues.text: They're in my pocket! I'm just reaching in my pocket for the keys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet down and do it already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fisher reaches into his pocket and produces the keys. They jingle as he holds them out in his trembling hand. Will snatches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen, I don't want you to report this car stolen or anything until later tonight. Let's say 5 o'clock. 6 to be safe. 54.

dialogues.speaker: MR. FISHER
dialogues.text: Sure. Anything you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will seems unconvinced. He looks to Chet, who shrugs. Wil turns back to Mr. Fisher and gestures violently with the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you fuck with us, I swear, I will...I will shoot your son. Taylor. I know where he works. At the fucking travel agency. He's the douchebag with the bangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please no. I won't do anything. I won't. Just leave Taylor alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna trust you. But if you call the police, there's gonna be an undertaker styling his stupid fucking bangs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now open the garage door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fisher hits a switch that raises the garage door. Che grabs their stuff and gets in the passenger side. Will ba toward the driver side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car's insured, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fisher nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I feel better. Worse comes to worst, something happens to it, you can get a Honda. This thing doesn't even have airbags.

dialogues.speaker: MR. FISHER
dialogues.text: Please, just go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will slides into the car and starts it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car peels away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys yank off their ski masks. 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That old man's got a heart condition! You could have killed him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hand was forced!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet tries to get comfortable in the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome. I'm stuck inside an even smaller car with you and a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will works the manual transmission. He steps on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing's got some pickup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you just take it easy, we're doing fine on time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...but there's one last stop we have to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have to take a piss first? Because I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will nervously drums his fingers on the steering wheel, t to figure out how to say -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you for real? Did you really just ask me that? You salt-in-an- open-wound motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet, as if it isn't apparent, I may die today. I'll probably die today. And if there's one small thing that's clear to me now, it's that I've wasted two and a half decades as a pussy, watching everything I want pass me by. I don't wanna peace out of this world as a pussy. I need to tell her how I feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really gonna turn this into some sort of dying wish bullshit? 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I really am. It means that much to me. I am not fucking around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you are. I mean, apparently, you love my sister so much that you're willing to put her life in danger by going to see her with a bomb strapped to your chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't be in danger. I promise. I got it all worked out. And you can even take a piss while I'm inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Datsun pulls around and parks in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK TO REVEAL the minivan parking across the street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne and Jay watch Will hurry out of the Datsun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is he going? What's in there? Some sort of FBI headquarters? I told that guy not to fuck around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne pulls out his cell phone, punches in the speed dia code. His finger hovers above the send button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should give that bomb a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Let me just go see what he's up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just fucking around. Are you gay for this guy or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna get the money, Dwayne. Same as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Then man up and go check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jay reaches for the door handle - 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even tell me you're about to do a reconnaissance without a cover. What's you cover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...I'm from the telephone company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, nice fucking uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne rummages in the back of the car, produces a shoppi bag and starts filling it with random clothes strewn acro the car. He shoves the bag at Jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a personal shopper. You're delivering the latest fashions to Mr. Quilby in marketing. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay nods, hops out with the bag and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne looks down at the cell phone in his hand, twirls i as he hums a revival song...sings the lyrics, softly -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "He's got the whole world in his hands. He's got whole fucking world in his hands..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will runs up the stairs, a phone pressed to his ear -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...no, I'm here right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you acting so strange?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because strange shit is going on. I'll explain everything. Just meet me where I texted you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Just do it. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see the entire shitty town from up here. The acce door opens and Kate emerges, wind tousling her short hair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will waves at her from where he is standing, way across o the other side of the roof. Kate starts toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes out his cell phone and dials. Kate's phone rin She answers it, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We STAY on Will. We can see Kate, standing 30 feet away, but her voice comes over Will's cell phone, with a delay that is slightly jarring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't come any closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna give you the short version of an incredibly complicated and fucked up situation, so please be cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some very bad guys strapped a bomb to my chest and they are forcing me to commit a crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, I swear, if this is -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I was joking, but I'm not. I know it's a lot to swallow, but you gotta take it on face value, because there's a timer attached to this thing and it's counting down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's voice falters -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, Will...we'll get help. I'll get you help. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't come here for help. I'm taking care of it. I came here because, should things not work out today as I would like them to, I want you to know why I was doing the things I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, just let me call someone. Let me do something. This is crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't disagree with you. It's fucking nuts. But that's not even what this is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember when you found that picture in my car of you, me and Chet, with Chet cut out of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, I can't remember about some stupid picture while you're -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to remember about the picture, and about how I stop by your office every Friday, and how I've always hated all your boyfriends, and how the two girls I've ever seriously dated have looked like less attractive versions of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see where I'm going with this? I love you Kate. I have for a very long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is barely holding it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, this is a lot you're putting on me! You just told me people are trying to kill you or something, and now you say you love me. What the fuck is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whole lot of shit. I'm sorry to do this to you, but I was afraid I'd never get the chance to tell you. And I know you have feelings for me, too. Maybe you feel for me the way you feel for a good friend, or - if the world fucking hates me - a brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what I hope is that you don't really know how you feel for me, and that maybe when you figure it out you'll realize it's the same way I feel for you. Does that make any sense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I mean, I've known you forever. It's not an easy thing to figure out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need an answer now. Just think about it. And no matter what you decide, you're too good for assholes like Mark and the rest of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate manages a small, stifled laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I will process all of this. It's just, the bomb -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's distracting. I know. Anyway, I'd love to stay and talk some more, but I can't. I gotta ask you to leave now, because I'm running out of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods. Will hangs up the phone. She turns back toward the access door, stops. She yells across the roof at Will

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had time to think about it...I'd probably tell you that I've always felt very strongly for you. And I've never thought of you as a brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will smiles, yells back -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a huge relief. Don't say anything else. I just really don't want to die now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try not to. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate turns and continues to the access door. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay paces about the landing that leads up to the roof. He hears the door opening and hurries down to the entrance f the nearest floor. He tries the door, but it's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate enters the stairwell from the roof access door and s Jay trying to force the door open. She is holding back te He just looks incredibly confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm, uh...I'm a personal shopper. I'm looking for Mr. Quilby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I don't know who that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate continues down the stairs, tears coming now. Jay wai a beat, then hurries down and tries the door on the next level, which is open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay jumps in the van, huffing and puffing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just his girlfriend or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting one last blow job in case he don't make it. I kinda like this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, galvanized by the exchange, hops inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell her how you saw her naked when she was 13? That always works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said my piece. She's gonna think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. She was freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. By the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By you. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it be so bad if we ended up together? You and I would be family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you in the family. You bring very little to the table. I want her to be with someone awesome. A pro quarterback. A war hero. At the very least, someone I've never watched porn with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now it's up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if I set that bomb off myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'd probably never get to rob a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will throws the car into gear and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER COUNTDOWN: 4 hours, 10 minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Datsun is parked in the half-full lot. The guys lean against the driver side, with their backs to the bank and the car providing cover. They each have a spray painted a pistol tucked into their pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go for the money. I'll cover the crowd. In and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet clasps his hands around his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not feeling so good. I drank like three of those 5-Hour Energy drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just nerves. Let's pull our shit together and do this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet reigns it in. The guys slide on the leather gloves a rolled up ski masks. They turn and stride toward the bank

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys stop as they get to the door. They pull the ski masks down and take out their air pistols. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should I call you in there, like if I need to ask you to do something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Tivon. You'll be Darius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you're not a black guy through the ski mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Then you'll be Luis and I'm Cruz. We're two loco motherfuckers and that's the way we gotta roll when we get in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's business as usual for a dozen CUSTOMERS and about as many EMPLOYEES. They all just want to get done with their shit and go home, when -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Chet burst through the bank doors, guns in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody put your hands in the air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, get on the ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, listen to him and get on the fucking ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Chet are on an adrenaline high, waving their gun everywhere. People scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will frantically scans the panicked crowd for -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SECURITY GUARD (40s), rail thin and jumpy. Will point his gun right at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, just stand right there and don't do shit! The rest of you get the fuck down! Spread your arms and legs! Why is no one listening to me!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take it easy, man! 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a hero, cowboy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck does that mean? I'm not a hero! Or a cowboy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As people drop to the ground, whispering nervously to one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet rushes the TELLERS standing behind the bulletproof g partition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of you, back away from the counter and get out here! Anyone pushes a button and one of these people gets totally shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tellers hurry into the main area of the bank and get onto their stomachs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks to the Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very slowly, take out your gun and toss it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard takes out his gun, lays it on the ground and sh it away. The gun slides across the waxed floor and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right into the outstretched hand of a sobbing MOM (40s), whose DAUGHTER (11) lies beside her in a soccer uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, god! I don't want the gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck!? Did you do that on purpose!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys working together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Please take this gun away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just toss it, lady! 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mom slides the gun away like it were on fire. It skid all the way across the floor, slams hard against a wall a

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FAT MAN has been shot. He clutches his thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she got the femoral artery!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry! It was an accident!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Who slides a gun like that!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, what's happening!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christi, be quiet. These men are dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet turns ashen. He moves close to Will, whispers urgent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fucked. That dude is gonna bleed out and we're gonna go to prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is no one getting me help!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anyone here a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just the heavy breathing of many frightened peop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will hurries over to the Fat Man, who is bent over, huggi his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, let me see where you're hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just call me an ambulance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, sir. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fat Man sits up, removes his hand from his leg. Will nervously takes a look. There is only a small amount of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a flesh wound. You're gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it hurts so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got shot, man. It's not supposed to feel good. But you're gonna be fine. And you'll have a great story to tell everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an awful story! This isn't a bank error in my favor! I got shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point taken. Luis, how we doing on the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet snaps back to attention -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. Sorry, Cruz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet picks out the most harmless looking teller, a mousy something girl, and helps her up off the ground. He check her name tag: SANDRA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sandra. I know you're probably scared right now, but if you go grab us 100 grand in a bag, we'll get out of here. This will all be over and you'll be fine. You trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra nods. Chet smiles, reassuringly. She hurries behin the counter, starts filling a bank bag with cash, as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My leg really hurts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you please hurry up, Sandra!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra emerges from behind the partition with the bank ba Will grabs it. He takes a last look at the people spread across the floor. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry, everyone. I know we probably fucked up your day. (looks to Fat Man) I'm thinking of you in particular, sir. Actually, you know what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will crosses to the Fat Man, offers the bank bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly. Peel a few bills. On me. Anyone rats him to the cops and I'm coming for you. I remember faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fat Man hesitantly reaches for the bag. Opens it -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Dye explodes all over his face. He shrieks. Chet whir on the teller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that about, Sandra? I thought we had something going! What happened to trust?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry! They make us do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you kindly fill another bag? Not a bank bag. A fucking garbage bag. And Luis, will you watch her this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra hurries back behind the partition with Chet. He du out the contents of a trash can, grabs the bag and watche closely as Sandra stuffs it with cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. That should be enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet grabs the bag and hustles out toward Will. They are home free, until -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear the wail of approaching sirens outside. They st cold, panicked. Will whirls on the Tellers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! Which one of you assholes tripped the alarm!? Was it you, Sandra!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It was Mark! He pushed the button when you guys came in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another teller, MARK, looks up from the floor. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra, you bitch! Now they're gonna kill us both!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Mark! You're the manager!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will loses his shit -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck both of you! Fuck all of you! I'm a regular guy! Just like you! I'm a regular guy and you fucked me! Thank you for fucking a regular guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are freaked out. Sandra is crying, thinking she wi probably get shot now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet grabs Will and pulls him toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys slam through the doors, out into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as a lone police cruiser screeches into the lot. Wil and Chet make a run for it, but the cruiser cuts them off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER ZURMAN (21), a jittery rookie, jumps out of the c and levels his gun. The guys reflexively level theirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop your weapons!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the guns or I'll have to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet looks at Will with utter desperation. In the distanc they hear the sirens of more cops approaching. Will tosse his gun, rips open his jacket and grabs a cluster of wire

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! You just brought a gun to a bomb fight, officer! I pull these wires out and we all go! You got ten seconds to drop your gun and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zurman doesn't stick around for the rest. He turns and sprints away. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the guys make for the Datsun -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was tempting a desperate motherfucker. The guys jump in the Datsun and peel out as two more poli cruisers race toward the bank. The cruisers change course and give chase. The Datsun blows right by the parked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne watches as the cars speed off into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Our boy is causing some serious mayhem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna get caught or killed. Dwayne whirls on Jay, punches him hard in the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up! If you jinx this with your negativity, I'm gonna strap a bomb to your chest next. Jay massages his shoulder, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, who's gonna build it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whiplash blur as the three cars race by, one after the ot Airborne leaves flutter in their wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet freaks out as they hurtle toward lunchtime traffic. Will weaves in and out of cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! This is not cool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will is wild eyed, punching the gas. Chet's head is on a swivel. Behind them: police cruisers in hot pursuit. Up a the world rushing at them at 80 mph, populated by nothing potential collisions that will result in a fiery death. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should pull over and surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can outrun these guys. They're not the FBI, they're local cops. Just shut up and let me concentrate. I do this for a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they clip the side-view mirror off a Kia -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't do anything like this for a living! I am not a pizza, I am a man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruisers are gaining ground, throttles wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will downshifts, spiking the RPMs into the red, as he ban a hard right and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Datsun explodes onto a crowded street. PEDESTRIANS crossing an intersection jump out of its way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruisers take the turn into town. One makes it. The other slams into parked cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will jumps the curb to avoid slow-moving traffic, slams i newspaper dispenser. It flips up onto the hood and crashe into the windshield, where it stays lodged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will veers back into the street and blindly plows ahead a cars he cannot see swerve to avoid him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finally slams the brakes, the momentum knocking the dispenser loose and launching it onto the sidewalk, scatt Pedestrians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet whirls around to see the cruiser flying right at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will steps on the gas. The light ahead turns red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop! Stop! 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will rolls the dice and blows through the intersection. He's lucky. The cruiser behind him is not. It's T-boned b traffic in a brutal, crunching collision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruiser wreckage disappears in the rear-view mirror a Will floors it toward a green light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy got fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the rushing moment as they cross the intersection, Che glimpses the other cruiser barreling toward his side of t car from the perpendicular street. He has a millisecond, maybe, to process their impending doom, and then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruiser smashes into the back passenger side of the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Datsun is sent spinning like a fucking top. Its ruine back wheel catches, sending the car tumbling onto its roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madness. The guys scream as the car continues to slide, upside down, out of control. As it slams into a row of parking meters, the world goes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will blinks back to reality. He's hanging, inverted, by h seat belt. The car is a pool of shattered glass. It twink up at him. Hours could have passed, but it's only been seconds. He sucks in air. Satisfied that he is, in fact, still alive, he looks over at -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered and bruised Chet, head drooping straight back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet? Are you okay? Chet!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were gonna blow up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's hands go to the bomb...still intact. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Luckily your side took most of the impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will unclicks his seat belt and falls to the roof of the car. He moves to Chet, unclicks his belt and helps him do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will emerges from the overturned car. He drags Chet out, along with the bag of cash. He glances up to see the OFFI who crashed into them stumbling out of his own ruined car which has turned a fire hydrant into a geyser. Another cruiser races to the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck, man. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pulls Chet to his feet and they take off, rounding a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Will huffs and puffs -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet...I don't know how to tell you this...but you got a piece of the car in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet glances back to see a jagged piece of metal sticking out of his shoulder blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Get it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it now! 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without breaking stride, Will yanks the piece of metal ou of Chet's back. He screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it rusty? Am I gonna get tetanus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, two Officers turn into the alley in full spr They are way faster than the guys and soon gain on them. Will can barely keep up with Chet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you moving so slowly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a combination of cheap sneakers and this heavy fucking bomb on my chest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst out of the alley, onto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys frantically search for an escape, spot -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus pulling up to a stop down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sprint for the the bus, peeling off their ski masks waving as it lazily rolls away from the stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus slows and the guys trip over each other to board

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys fall into seats, gasping for air, a complete mes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks out the window to see the Officers emerge from the alley and look around for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd has grown around the crash sites. Fire trucks and ambulances are on the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne and Jay make their way through the crowd, trying t see what's what. Dwayne approaches a RANDOM LOCAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear what happened to the guys they were after? 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like they got away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne and Jay beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are covered in sweat as they hike along, eyes on the lookout. They arrive at Will's parked Mustang. Will hugs the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thought I'd see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you hated this car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's actually not that bad. You know, as compared to that Datsun. The Mustang's got more comfortable seats. And it never would have flipped over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys get in. They sit there for a moment, silent exce for their heavy breathing. Will's eyes go to the garbage bag sitting between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a 100 grand in there. 100 fucking grand. Which we stole. From a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told a bunch of people I was gonna shoot someone. I was like "you fucking move, and I will kill you where you stand!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I threatened to blow up a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you never said "I will kill you where you stand."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But shit did get pretty crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will starts to get a little emotional. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, there's no one I would have rather taken down a fucking bank with. I mean that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as for all that shit I said...and all that shit I did...I hope you can forgive me. We've been friends for so long, and I guess you hurt the people you're closest to the most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I messed up, too. I'm a dude who slept with his best friend's ex- girlfriend, and destroyed his parents' marriage, and sat on the sidelines watching his downward spiral. I'm a shitty human being. But I'm glad you know that now, because you can accept me for who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. I accept you. Because you accept me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will goes in for a hug. Chet gets lost in the moment, bef recoiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woah! You still got a bomb on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. Let's take care of that. But you owe me a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pulls the slip of paper Dwayne gave him from his poc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all gravy from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes out his cell and dials the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne and Jay cross toward a McDonald's. Dwayne stops an answers his vibrating cell phone. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This who I think it is?

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Can't you hear the ticking in the background?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're a pretty funny guy.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Thanks. I'm happy to entertain a complete psychopath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait a second, you're the murderer.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of those cops who wrecked his car chasing you...he ain't breathing no more. Will goes white, covers the phone and whispers to Chet -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We killed a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were driving! I'm just an accomplice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna hunt us down and kill us. Cops don't take this shit lightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet he had like eight kids. We have to find them and support his family forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne is holding back laughter. Finally bursts out.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What's so fucking funny!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just messin' with you. You didn't kill anyone. How'd a moron like you manage to rob a bank?

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Jesus! Can we just get this over with? Where do you want the money? 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a boarded up gas station out on Commerce Avenue, past the highway. Be there in 30 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll be there in ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'll be standing around with your dick in one hand, and my money in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne hangs up. He dials another number -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Juicy, wrangle your boy. Money's on its way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang shrieks past us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER COUNTDOWN: 2 hours, 58 minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne and Jay sit at a table with a fast food feast spre out. Dwayne eats a Big Mac, a look of utter satisfaction his face, a man whom the gods have finally smiled down up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember the summer after my mother passed was the first year they had the Monopoly game at McDonald's. I musta come here three times a day trying to collect all the game pieces. Packed on 20 pounds, got acne from all the grease. The Major said I was the fattest, ugliest 13-year-old he ever laid eyes on. But I didn't care, I just wanted to win the money and get the fuck out of there. So, one night, I followed this skinny register kid home, jumped him. I kept whaling on him, asking him where they were hiding the Park Place piece. The million dollar prize. But he didn't know shit. A year later, The Major won the lotto. I asked him for a Sega Genesis. He bought me one of those paddles with the ball attached. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne goes for a fry, sees his carton is empty and grabs handful of Jay's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not ashamed to admit that I've gone through some dark times since then. Depression. Addiction to a variety of shit, which I won't go into. I know you must think that's pretty silly, especially since you manage to get through the day and you don't got shit going on as compared to me. But that's just the way it is. That's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay looks pretty affected that Dwayne is opening up to hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've been pretty low, too... if you ever want to talk about that kinda stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't. My whole point I was trying to make before you interrupted me was that that shit is all in the past. 'Cause I did it. I finally pulled it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pulled it off, Dwayne. The two us. We're a good team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we? Would you do anything to protect me, my money, my empire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, like what kinda stuff are we talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne takes out his cell, keys in the speed dial code an slides the cell across the table to Jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you push the button?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you want me to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a question, Jay. Would you? If I asked you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, it's no different than those watermelons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watermelons aren't alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they are. Not the ones you blew up, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne stares hard at Jay. A tense beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one gets hurt...right, Dwayne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. I forgot about that part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
