dialogues.text: Anyway, he hasn't even made the drop yet. I'm gonna go take a shit. Stay away from the bathroom. Someone could get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne heads off. Jay eyes the cell phone he has left beh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weeds have overtaken the abandoned place. Will leans agai his parked car, waiting. Chet is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will spots Vaughn's Sentra approach. It pulls into the station and Vaughn steps. He could not look more menacing Juicy hangs back in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the other guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the only guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will picks up the garbage bag at his feet and walks it ov to Vaughn. He opens it, looks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you do...rob a bank? 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now where's the code?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn turns to leave. Will grabs his arm. Vaughn stops, looks purposefully down at Will's hand. Will draws back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, man, I just want the code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what the fuck you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The code for the fucking bomb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will opens his jacket. Vaughn takes a sudden step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of stupid motherfucker wears a bomb to a drop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boss put this on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am my boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then give me the code!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker, I don't know no goddamn code. Whoever told you I did, lied to you. Now step the fuck off, or I'll shoot you in the face so you don't explode and mess up my boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn goes to leave again. Will runs ahead of him and ge in his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't have the code, I want that money back. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way you're getting this money back is if you kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what I've gone through for that money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an instant, Vaughn has his gun out, aimed at Will's he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look sympathetic? Now step the fuck aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juicy looks on with interest as Vaughn holds Will at gunp Then she spots

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet creeping up behind Vaughn, from wherever he was hidi clutching a large metal pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juicy jumps out of the Sentra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn, look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn whirls around toward Chet, just in time to have hi gun arm smashed by the pipe. The weapon drops from his ha Chet takes another swing, cracking Vaughn across the face He howls, blood spraying, and topples over. Chet goes for another swing, when -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juicy jumps on him, wildly biting and clawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will grabs the back of Juicy's track jacket for leverage flings her away. She hits the back of the Sentra and care clear across the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will grabs the money. Chet kicks Vaughn's gun into the bushes. The guys break for the Mustang and get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juicy gets to her feet, runs right by a dazed Vaughn and after the car, which pulls out into the road and leaves h behind, screaming and cursing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's mind is racing. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tried to screw us. You're a liability. They were just gonna let you blow up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with the money they won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tidy space, filled with various half-finished devices, action figures and heavy metal posters. A low mechanical hum registers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne sits on a stool in the center of the garage, while Jay carefully trims his hair with an electric clipper. Dw holds up a mirror to check out his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never comes out this nice when I do it myself. You might wanna take some more off the top, though. I wanna look real professional when I go down to the morgue to identify the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne's phone chimes from a nearby counter. He grabs it, looks at the incoming number, slightly concerned. He answ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drop the money yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will yells into the phone -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I've still got the money! And I cracked your friend's face open!

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Why the fuck would you do that!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied! You said I'd get the code!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne is panicked, covers badly -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave him the code. He told me he committed it to memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was probably just embarrassed that he forgot it. I'll call him up and -

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You didn't give him shit! I want the code now or you'll never see this money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on there, big man. You got a bomb on you. I got a cell phone that detonates it. You're not exactly negotiating from a position of leverage.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm holding the money. I blow up, and it blows up. Who has the leverage now? Go ahead and push the button, you idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet freaks out -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell him to push the button! Pull over! Pull over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne is getting pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you watch what the fuck you say! I own you! I tell you to rob a bank, and you rob a bank. I tell you to give me the money, and you give me the goddamn money and hope I show you some mercy.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm tired of this bullshit. I'm already dead, right? So fuck you. At least I'll die rich. I can't say the same for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line goes dead. Dwayne tears off his haircut smock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That piece of shit hung up on me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet grabs the wheel and forces Will to pull over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out of this car! 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet jumps out while the Mustang is still slowing down. H runs 20 yards away. Will turns the car off and gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was colossally stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a negotiation tactic. He'll call back and I won't answer. Then he'll call back and I will answer, and he'll realize the only way he gets the money is if he gives me the code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure! That seems like a perfectly logical pattern of thought! I bet that's exactly what he'll do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne tries Will's phone again. It goes to voicemail. He explodes like a pack of Mentos in a two-liter of Diet Cok Throws his cell across the room. Overturns a work table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this guy know who the fuck I am!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay retreats into a corner. Dwayne's a big boy, and he so tires himself out, hunches over, panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne...you never told me you weren't going to give him the code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not amateurs. He was a loose end. I let him live, someday I woulda been walking out of my mansion and... bam! FBI, CIA, NSA, all converging on my front lawn, 'cause a loose end turned state's evidence and they got what they need to put me away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne shakes his head. Starts digging through the mess he's made...finds his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it, Jay. I'll just kill The Major myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne keys in the speed dial code. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne looks down at the send button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they say about a tree falling in the forest? Maybe the same thing applies to blowing up some motherfucker across town. Maybe it doesn't even make a sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne hits send.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Dwayne notices something...the phone in his hand is ringing. He puts it to his ear. The line connects -

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello...who is this...hello...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne snaps the phone shut, looks to Jay, who tries to w the beads of sweat back into his pores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did I just call, Jay? 'Cause she sounded cute for a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina Kim. My seventh grade crush. Or whoever lives in Gina Kim's house now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the number for the bomb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my head. I switched it out of your phone while you were taking a shit. You're out of control, Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in perfect control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne charges Jay. Jay holds up the hair clippers like a weapon, flicks them on. Dwayne rips the cord out of the wall, uses it to yank the clippers from Jay's hand, then whips him with the cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne goes to whip Jay again, but Jay moves like a jack and delivers a fierce kidney shot. Dwayne stumbles backwa falls onto the couch, groans -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asshole...I make you my partner and you pull this shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired of you pushing me around all the time! What kinda partner does that!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you...I'm gonna piss blood, aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what it said on the internet. Dwayne's phone rings in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. Get it out for me. I can barely move. Jay pulls the cell from Dwayne's pocket...opens it and pu it to his ear so he can answer -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad you came to your senses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn has a rag pressed to his swollen, bloody face. Jui is nearby, banged up and dirty. Vaughn yells into his cel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck do you think you're talking to!?

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I honestly don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me give you a hint: your boy just jumped me, tossed my bitch like a rag doll and split with the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne realizes who's on the other line, recovers -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy's not my boy. He's a dick. I'm sorry for all the, uh, confusion. 87.

dialogues.speaker: VAUGHN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Confusion? The only motherfucker that's confused is you. Apparently, you think you can fuck me and survive the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't fucking you, I was fucking him. You gotta understand, you're like a pawn in a much larger game I'm playing here.

dialogues.speaker: VAUGHN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Did you just call me a pawn, you stupid fuck!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it like that. I'm just juggling a whole lot of shit.

dialogues.speaker: VAUGHN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I want my money. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That may not be possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to put this out there, to keep you in the loop...but I may need to bump the hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn paces, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a reservation at Sizzler! You don't "bump" it! I want you to bring me my money right now, to where I am standing in this shit hole town, bleeding from the motherfucking face!

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I don't exactly have the money...give me some time and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deal's off! You just became the hit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn hangs up, tosses the bloody rag to the ground and screams in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lives with his daddy. You already got the address. 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne looks down at his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. The assassin's gonna kill me now. I'm gonna die. Game fucking over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne cradles his arms around his wounded kidney, rocks back and forth, wallowing in defeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can still get him the money. Try the pizza guy back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? So he can fuck around again, and I wind up dead, anyway? No. I'd rather just sit here. I want to die right here on this couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We're gonna get that money. Just like we planned. All we gotta do is get the leverage back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we do that? Pizza boy's obviously got some kinda death wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay gathers his resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take the girl. The one he went to see. Then he won't try shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne looks up at Jay with something not unlike awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's actually...that's a great fucking idea, Jay. It's the best idea anyone's had all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne lowers his head. He removes the gun from his belt...holds it out to Jay. Jay takes it. Feels its weigh Then offers it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just trying to figure out how you would do it, Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne takes the gun. Struggles to stand. Jay helps him. 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Then let's do it right. We leave nothing to chance. Because if we go to prison for this, I won't be able to watch out for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne looks over at a frame backpack hanging from a hook the wall. PVC piping bulges from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should probably bring the flamethrower, buddy. There's gonna be some evidence to dispose of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Chet sit on the ground, still 20 yards apart. Ch checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been half an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In another 30 minutes I'm calling the bomb squad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet gestures to the vast emptiness all around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys obviously aren't watching you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, even if they get the bomb squad here in time, and they can somehow get this thing off me, we still gotta answer for the robbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the heat with you, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I'll tell them I forced you into it. That you didn't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, man. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks at Chet for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? You're not gonna think about it a little longer? After all we went through...tear down the relationship, rebuild it...you're gonna let me go to prison alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You offered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a test. Your grade: F minus. You know what the "F" is for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To fuck myself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You passed that test. Failed the important one. As the guys continue to argue - SUPER COUNTDOWN: 1 hour, 28 minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate walks down a hallway, turns into an office. Two figu rush past from the intersecting hallway and duck behind a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate emerges from the office and continues into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate goes to the mirror, checks herself out. She's been crying. She splashes water on her face, then enters a sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom door opens and Dwayne and Jay enter. Dwayne pulls something hairy from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the stall, Kate reaches for some toilet paper...fr underneath the barrier, she notices two pairs of dirty, masculine sneakers. Her breath goes shallow. She takes ou her cell, quietly opens it. She presses the first 9 in "9 but her keypad volume is on and the phone makes a dull, electronic beep that echoes in the quiet bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Why don't you just slide the phone under the door, so I don't have to kick it open and see you with your panties down. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate slides the phone out. One of the sneakers crushes it She gets off the toilet, arranges her clothing and steps out of the stall. She gasps at -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two ominous men standing there in gorilla masks. Dway gun is plainly visible, tucked into the front of his pant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the quietest way out of the building? 'Cause I might get excited in a confrontation, and you might wind up shot in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Major is watching reruns of Three's Company. He doesn laugh or remotely smile at any of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The subtle click of a door opening does not escape his fi tuned senses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. The Major gets up and goes to a desk, rifles thr a drawer and pulls something out. A simple pen. He clutch it like a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Major creeps along.

dialogues.speaker: VAUGHN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Just stay where you are, old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Major turns to find Vaughn pointing a gun at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if I knew where he was, I wouldn't tell you nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I saved a black man's life in the shit. So if I took yours I'd be even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see where your son gets his common sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you might want to readjust your attitude, because I ain't fucking around. I want Dwayne. I don't know why you'd want to protect him, the motherfucker hired me to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this news has any effect at all on The Major, he doesn show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me where he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn pulls back the hammer of his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm scared of death? There's a whole generation of gooks that think I'm the grim reaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn shakes his head. Almost imperceptibly, The Major repositions the hand with the pen in it. Vaughn is about squeeze the trigger -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But The Major beats him to it, clicking the pen, which is actually a pen gun. It fires a .22 caliber round into Vau neck. He drops the gun and clutches the geyser of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Major charges Vaughn, jumps on him and wrestles him t the ground, trying to jam the pen into the wound in his n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ride you all the way to hell! I know exactly how to get there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn reaches for his gun. His fingers curl around it an he whips it across The Major's face, knocking him backwar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn scrambles to his feet, gun pointed at the felled M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now, old man!? You can't kill me! None of y'all can kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Major looks up at Vaughn, once again face to face wit loaded weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Major goes limp, one searing hole in his chest. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn clasps a hand to his neck to staunch the flow of b He steps over the The Major's body and continues upstairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn rifles through the cabinets, dumps all of the firs aid supplies into the sink. He gets to work on his wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The locked door is kicked open. Vaughn, neck crudely bandaged, flicks on the lights and looks around the child room. Chinese Fighting Fish swim in a large tank, seem to stop and look out at him like guard dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn ransacks the place. He finds a desk drawer locked. Takes out his gun and blows it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn pulls a stuffed file folder out of the drawer. Fli through it. It's full of details about Dwayne's plan, the tanning salon, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker has lost his mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds a map of the town in the file. Three locations a highlighted: the bank, the boarded up gas station, and th radio tower. PUSH IN on the radio tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn stuffs the map into his pocket. He stops before le the room, turns and shatters the fish tank with the butt his gun. Water spills out and the Chinese Fighting Fish f onto the floor. As Vaughn lifts a boot to stomp them -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Chet are still arguing -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the upshot, while you're behind bars you can finally finish your degree. If I was there, too, it would just be a distraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great idea, Chet. Thanks a lot. I'll just sit here and figure out a fucking major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stews. After a beat, his hand goes to his pocket. It's vibrating. He pulls out his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's them. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will answers -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready to talk now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne drives with his cell pressed to his ear. Jay keeps watch on Kate in back. She is blindfolded, hands bound be her back with duct tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm ready to talk. I want my money. Meet me back at the radio tower in 50 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I've barely got an hour left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the point. I want you on a short leash.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Fuck that. Give me the code first. Then you can have your money. You'll just have to trust me when I say that I don't want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm sure. You just wanna go back to your fantastic life. Your great job. And that blonde bitch with the sexy voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's mind jumps to the only logical conclusion. Roller coaster stomach drop. His voice cracks as he asks a usele

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It means that girl you paid a visit to today is sitting in the back of my van right now. And it ain't exactly consensual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! You crossed a line! 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne just laughs, maniacally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no lines! There's just me and you and 100 thousand dollars. Once we get that shit in order, you can have her back, and your life, too. So you're gonna show up where I say, when I say. Alone. And if you try anything stupid, the two of you will be delivering pizzas to Saint Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got ten seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne hands the phone back to Jay, who puts it to Kate's ear. She is trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will...?

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Kate, I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay...I'm fine...I'm just really -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne snatches the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's just really gonna die if you fuck this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will absorbs this like a blow to the chest. The line disconnects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck does that mean!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took her, man. They must have followed us to her office. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! You had to go see her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I messed up...I finally messed up worse than I could have possibly imagined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get her back, Will. These guys are crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still got the money. As long as we have that, she's alive. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet grabs the bag of cash. They hustle into the car and peels out, leaving behind a swirling cloud of dust. As th sun begins to set -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER COUNTDOWN: 58 minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two menacing headlights come at us on the empty road. The

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn holds up Dwayne's map as he drives. He seems to be on the right road, headed for the radio tower. He crumple the map and throws it in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang stops by the gate to the radio tower. Chet ju out and disappears into the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang pulls up. Will gets out and looks around the deserted place. He holds up the money bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the shadow of the nearby shed, the minivan is revealed its interior lights come on. The door opens and Dwayne emerges, in his mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time you got left? 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes off the jacket and tosses it to the ground. He looks at the timer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Maybe we should just wait around for the money shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys meet in a clearing. Dwayne nods at the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Where's the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the van. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her out here. You're wasting time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will grips the bag close to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne whistles. The minivan door opens and Jay steps out Strapped to his back is the frame pack we saw at his work A long tube connects the pack to the handle of a metal pi like device in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay helps Kate, still bound and blindfolded, out of the v They approach Dwayne and take up position behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here. It's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a fucking tearjerker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let her come over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. But you should know, my associate over there is packing a flamethrower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay aims the metal device he has been holding. He hits a button and a pilot light comes on. 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do what we say. Don't mess around or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless either of you can outrun a 25- foot flame. (gestures to gun in his belt) Or a bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne roughly pulls Kate away from Jay and shoves her forward. Will grabs her, pulls her blindfold off and push her behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave you the girl. Now give me the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about we get the code out of the way first, since this bomb happens to be ticking so close to all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne pulls a slip of paper from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready to be a free man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give it to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will keys in the numbers. The timer freezes and the lock the hinge opens. Will carefully extricates himself from t vest. He lays it down on the ground and steps away from i His shirt is drenched in sweat from where the bomb sat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes a final look at the money bag, then throws it Dwayne. He looks inside, smiles. Jay takes a peak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so fucking pretty, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's awesome. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne looks up at Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you can get out of here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I actually have this sneaking suspicion that once we turn around, you're gonna put a bullet in both of our backs - and this is just a guess - burn our bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say great minds think alike. And in this case, so do we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured as much. That's why I got a gun pointed at you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a sniper in the bushes locked on you right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look that dumb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell, you're wearing a mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Dwayne can react, he stops and blinks, something shining in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...on your forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne's eyes turn upward, just barely making out the red dot that dances on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. Well played.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bushes, hidden from sight, Chet carefully aims his laser pointer at Dwayne's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will grins at Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna walk out of here now. If you shoot, my sniper shoots. I can't guarantee he'll get both of you. But he'll definitely get you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Will turns away - 100.

dialogues.speaker: VAUGHN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hold the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn emerges from the darkness. He looks at Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't expecting to see you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning, Vaughn cracks Will over the head with th butt of his gun. He goes down hard. Kate screams. Vaughn points the gun at her and she shuts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne steps forward with the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all good. We got your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice mask, Dwayne. Now throw the money over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne complies. As soon as the bag lands, Vaughn aims th gun at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up. You don't have to do this. I just paid you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks on, terrified, an unconscious Will at her side

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn's eyes burn a hole through Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been hit with a pipe, shot with a pen, and wasted my whole motherfucking day...all because of you and this job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. Just take the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. And then I'm gonna tie up the two loose ends in the gorilla masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a loose end!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a fucking idiot. You are as loose as ends get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicked, Dwayne's eyes flash over to Jay, who tightens h grip on the flamethrower handle. Jay catches Dwayne's eye Dwayne nods. Vaughn sees this. 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay rears up with the flamethrower. Vaughn couldn't be mo surprised to see the device Jay is holding spit a massive ball of fire at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn dives to the ground, fires off two wild shots, one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nails Dwayne in the shoulder, spinning him backward and knocking him off his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate recoils in horror as: Vaughn scurries madly on the ground, intermittently firing, while Jay screams and trie to torch him with the 25-foot flame. A hand touches Kate' shoulder and she whirls around to find -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet!? What are you doing here!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now. We gotta take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks to the empty spot beside her where Will just w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flames inches from him, Vaughn lines up a desperate shot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good news: the bullet only grazes Jay's side. Bad news: i keeps going and punches through the flamethrower backpack which happens to be filled with gasoline, which happens t have an incredibly low flash point. So the spark from, sa a bullet, would cause

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Will pops up behind Chet and Kate, clutching t garbage bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the money. Let's get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take off toward Will's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne groggily comes to...no SOUND, just a ringing. The first thing he sees: Vaughn storming toward him, god-know what spewing from his mouth. Vaughn levels his gun -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't make a sound for two reasons. The second being that it's out of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne fumbles for his own hardware. Muzzle flash. 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn drops to his knees. Pulse snatched from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUND SLAMS BACK to the tune of Jay's screams. Dwayne loo over to see his friend in flames, flailing his arms and shrieking. Dwayne's head snaps to the other side, where h sees the Mustang's tires peel. He tears off his mask, frantically looks around. The money is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay disentangles himself from the backpack, the source of the flames, but his clothes are now ablaze. In his frenzy he somehow manages to string together two coherent words

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne! Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne gets to his feet as the Mustang roars down the driveway. He looks to Jay, then to his minivan. Dwayne's face: Two roads diverge in a wood. Which to take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Jay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne sprints over to Jay, rips off his jacket and uses to beat the flames down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop, drop and roll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay hits the deck. Dwayne continues fighting the flames, finally falls on top of Jay with the jacket spread and smothers the last of them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay looks up at Dwayne with puppy dog eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came back for me...you said you never would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't hesitate back there, Jay. You did good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay smiles. Flames overtake the field all around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go put a bullet in that motherfucker and get our money. Think you can get outta here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Go get him. 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne hurries toward the minivan. Jay stumbles up to his feet and limps off toward the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang travels away from the rising flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's face is a mess of dirt, sweat and dried blood. He and Chet stare ahead, completely shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks from one of them to the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...I just got kidnapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was totally Will's fault. In case you want to factor that in while you're mulling over the whole relationship thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry about the kidnapping. This is me, taking responsibility for it. Growing up. Like a viable life partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man has spied on you in the nude before!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No, I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying. He's trying to build a relationship on a foundation of lies. And it won't stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got kidnapped! Can we talk about that!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something catches Will's attention: a set of headlights rapidly growing larger in the rear-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne's speedometer is buried past 100 mph. His eyes bur with intensity. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will hits the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. One of those dudes is definitely not dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet and Kate look out the back window. Chet screams -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up! He's already on us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne's car pulls even with the Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks over at Dwayne, who pulls out his gun and take aim. He flashes a sick grin -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I own this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Dwayne can get a shot off -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An explosion rocks the minivan from inside. The back end lifted off the ground and the car tumbles over itself. It lands on its roof and skids into a ditch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet and Kate watch the burning wreck disappear out the b window. They are equal parts confused and happy to be ali

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the bomb I carried around all day. I reactivated it and put it in the back of his van. I guess his time was up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "His time was up?" Were you thinking that up the whole day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was prepared, yes. I can't help it if I'm the kind of guy who thinks about the future. 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not that kind of guy. He doesn't think about the future. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly happened since I saw you this afternoon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Primarily, we robbed a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!? So you're, like, fugitives? What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Will. What does the future hold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing good if we stay in town and they pin this on us. Kate, I think you should put in for that vacation time. Right now. If anyone gives you a problem, tell them to fuck off. There's 100 grand in that trash bag by your feet. A third of it's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate opens the bag...smiles through the dirt and grime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, that's -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucked up. Why does she get a share?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you get a share?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet stews. Will catches Kate's eyes in the rear-view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airport's 30 minutes away. Pick a destination. This time it's not a practice run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car zooms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER COUNTDOWN: 0 hours, 0 minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind fans the flames of the burning minivan. The shattere windshield sprouts another crack...then another, as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne's foot kicks it out. He drags himself from the smoldering steel carcass. He is a charred, blood splatter mess, but he is alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne is propped up against a sign, lingering on the edg of consciousness. The headlights of a lone pickup truck approach. Dwayne feebly waves the truck down for a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Dwayne stumbles through. He has made i home. He drops like a puppet whose strings have been cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From where his head has landed on the floor, Dwayne sees something odd...long red streaks. He crawls forward on al fours to investigate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a trail of sticky red blood. Dwayne follows it unti he comes upon its source...the crumpled body of his fathe lying face down. Dwayne's face: shock and confusion and j

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne inches closer, pokes the body. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, are you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body emits a low groan. Dwayne rolls it over. His father's face is white, he's lost a lot of blood, but he isn't totally spent yet. He struggles to speak -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some guy...said you hired him to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I...I'd never... 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you...lip quivering like you're getting fucked...be a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a man! I killed you, didn't I? Now I'm gonna use your money to open a tanning salon where they let you fuck the chicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stirs something in The Major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean...like those whorehouses...in 'Nam...I used to tell you about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne softens at the recollection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those were great bedtime stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Major nods. Opens his hand. Reveals a cordless phone. Dwayne looks to the bloody streaks down the hall, leading the phone table. The Major dragged himself the whole way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medics are late...probably a couple lazy spicks...you tell 'em I said so...all right, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing, pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Major looks up at Dwayne's bruised face, as if for th first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell of thing...I think I may...actually respect you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne's eyes well up. He reaches out, cradles his father as he expires. It's like a very bloody, white trash versi of the PietГ . Dwayne sobs uncontrollably, until -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops his father and pound-pound-pounds his chest in s approximation of a life saving resuscitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up, you pussy! Come on, soldier!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL AWAY as Dwayne pounds the body and distant sirens gr nearer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into waves. It's the ocean, long past sunset. PULL BACK t find a lone figure staring out at it, sitting on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will. Shirtless. Could be anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet approaches and sits beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking nine dollars to use the internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police think it was that black guy. They found some kind of map in his car. And I'm sure racial profiling played a part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nothing about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Guess it's time to head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking we'd stick around a little a longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? So you have more time to delude my sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And it'd be easier if you gave us five fucking minutes alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet stares out at the ocean for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think she's into you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kissed her last night. No tongue. Then you walked in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet just nods. Will gets up. 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna go fuck my sister now, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be thinking of you the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the very least...be a considerate lover. Give pleasure, before taking pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm reading you. And I will try my best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will heads up a trail that leads to a hotel bungalow. Kat opens the door, steps out onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stops, looks back at Chet. He whistles. Chet turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Riggs! You always have been!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet smiles, shakes his head as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will reaches the porch. He stands close to Kate. His nerv clock overtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lied and told your brother I kissed you. I thought it would make this easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's an idea: pretend you have a bomb strapped to your chest. Tick,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will closes the gap and kisses her. After a beat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Chet watching us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably. We should go inside. I promised him I'd satisfy you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate laughs, leads him inside and the door shuts to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they are pushed to one side of the screen, as the oth side is filled with -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lo-fi, 2001-style light tunnel. It deposits us in the furthest reaches of the galaxy, where we find -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tanning bed. Rotating in orbit. Dwayne's voice booms an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tanning bed explodes, like a star gone supernova. Fro the light and fire and chaos...emerges a logo:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bad MATCH CUT takes us to the same logo. Camera ZOOMS O unsteadily to reveal it is a banner above a strip mall storefront. We are watching a local commercial with appropriately poor production value.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne walks backward down a hallway while addressing cam and trying not to trip -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here at Major Tan, our specially trained technicians are hard at work developing new technologies that harness the power of the sun, to ensure a cutting-edge tanning experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne enters a tanning room. A man in a lab coat stares down at a clipboard, on which a complicated scientific equation is written.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it looking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man turns: it's Jay. His smiling face is speckled wit healing burn wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our most advanced tanning bed yet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures to a very ordinary looking tanning bed. 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't just take this scientist's word for it. The proof...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne snaps his fingers. A BAD SPECIAL EFFECT makes him disappear, then reappear with a totally orange tan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is in the tan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Dwayne back out into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Major Tan isn't just about looking good. It's also about feeling good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne gestures to another room. The door opens and Juicy saunters out in a bikini. A beat later, a RANDOM GUY exit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That "Deluxe Tan" was fantastic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne stands outside the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So come on down to Major Tan...where we're proud to be a family business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK TO REVEAL...The Major beside Dwayne. He's only about four feet tall now, on account of the wheelchair. B he's grinning like a jackal, in a POW-MIA cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SUPERED LOGO appears: Military Discounts Available!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As father and son smile and wave at us -
